content: creeper notes before you begin i suggest reading through my tips section at the end of the document if you have any questions or comments please message me you may sell anything you create from this pattern but you must credit me sharkythreads as the original designer link back to my etsy where applicable hook size s 2 5mm yarn weight 8ply colours green colour a black colour b *you will need over 100g of green* abbreviations us terms magic_ring - magic_ring single_crochet around - single_crochet for the rest of the row single_crochet - single_crochet cca - change to colour a fsc - foundation single_crochet ccb - change to colour b * … * - repeat head piece one make 1 start in green 1 18fsc or ch19 and 18sc across starting in 2nd chain from hook 2 - 60 ch1 and turn single_crochet across again i recommend placing stitch markers at each side every 20 row to make it easier to identify corners when sewing the pieces together leave a long tail on this second piece for sewing to sew the head together start by attaching each corner labeled a using the stitch marker then attach b to b and so on then sew along before closing the last edge stuff firmly ensuring the corners are shaped body start in green 1 30fsc or ch31 and 30sc across starting in 2nd chain from hook 2 - 16 ch1 and turn single_crochet across 17 24sc skip remaining stitches ch1 and turn this creates the flap which will later be folded to create the bottom side of the body 18 - 48 ch1 and turn single_crochet across i recommend placing stitch markers at 17 row 7 row and another 17 row after these are the corners leave a long tail for sewing sew the edges with the dashed lines together then attach corners a and a then b and b sew along these edges and stuff the stitch markers in blue are the corners for when you sew the body to the head creeper pattern ©sharkythreads 2024 legs piece one make 4 start in green 1 9fsc or sc10 and 9sc starting in 2nd chain from hook 2 -
